required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Study of Transarterial Chemoembolization of Lung Metastases

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being done to determine if it is safe to perform lung chemoembolization and if the lung chemoembolization procedure can successfully deliver chemotherapy to lung tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant toxicity will be evaluated according to CTCAE v5.0
primary_outcome.description: Safety will be evaluated by participant toxicity according to CTCAE v5.0

arm_group.arm_group_label: Lung, Endobronchial, Mediastinal or Pleural Metastases
arm_group.description: Participants will have unresectable and unablatable lung, endobronchial, mediastinal, or pleural metastases (from any primary) that are not responding to chemotherapy

intervention.description: Chemoembolization will be performed via the artery (bronchial, non-bronchial systemic, or pulmonary) that shows the greatest tumor enhancement on angiography. Chemoembolization will be performed using a lipiodol / mitomycin emulsion, followed by spherical particles.
intervention.arm_group_label: Lung, Endobronchial, Mediastinal or Pleural Metastases

intervention.description: Mitomycin (5mg/m^2,maximum mitomycin dose 20 mg) will be dissolved in lipiodol at 2 mg/ml on the day of procedure.
intervention.arm_group_label: Lung, Endobronchial, Mediastinal or Pleural Metastases

intervention.description: Mitomycin (5mg/m^2,maximum mitomycin dose 20 mg) will be dissolved in lipiodol at 2 mg/ml on the day of procedure.
intervention.arm_group_label: Lung, Endobronchial, Mediastinal or Pleural Metastases

intervention.description: Embospheres are non-resorbable spherical microspheres (trisacryl gelatin) that are FDA-approved for embolization of hypervascular tumors.
intervention.arm_group_label: Lung, Endobronchial, Mediastinal or Pleural Metastases

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lung, endobronchial, pleural, or mediastinal metastases that are not responding to systemic chemotherapy, and that are not amenable to ablation, resection, or SBRT.
- At least 18 years old.
- ECOG performance status 0 or 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Primary lung cancer
- >50% of a lung is replaced with tumor
- Oxygen saturation <92% on room air
- FEV1 <60%
- Pulmonary hypertension (diagnosed or suspected on echocardiography, CT, MRI, or direct pressure measurement)
- Recent pulmonary embolism (within 3 months)
- Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation
- Active lung infection (pneumonia, empyema, or lung abscess requiring therapy within 1 month)
- Symptomatic heart failure (dyspnea, volume overload)
- Left bundle branch block (contraindication to pulmonary angiography)
- Renal failure (eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73m^2)
- Pregnancy
- Breastfeeding
- Altered mental status that would interfere with consent or follow-up
- Platelets < 100,000 (after transfusion, if needed)
- INR>2 (after transfusion, if needed)
- Hemoglobin <7 (after transfusion, if needed)
- Hyperthyroidism (contraindication to lipiodol)
- Planned radioactive iodine imaging or therapy (contraindication to lipiodol)
- Allergy to lipiodol or mitomycin
- Allergy to iodinated contrast that can not be treated with steroid / diphenhydramine premedication
- Any condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, would interfere with evaluation of the investigational product or interpretation of subject safety or study results

facility.name: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center @ Commack (Consent Only)

patient_data.ipd_description: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center supports the international committee of medical journal editors (ICMJE) and the ethical obligation of responsible sharing of data from clinical trials. The protocol summary, a statistical summary, and informed consent form will be made available on clinicaltrials.gov when required as a condition of Federal awards, other agreements supporting the research and/or as otherwise required. Requests for deidentified individual participant data can be made beginning 12 months after publication and for up to 36 months post publication. Deidentified individual participant data reported in the manuscript will be shared under the terms of a Data Use Agreement and may only be used for approved proposals. Requests may be made to: crdatashare@mskcc.org.
